title: Configure the Operations Platform values YAML file
content:
You must deploy Operations Platform using Helm CLI. As discussed in the steps below, create a copy of the sample values.yaml provided with the Operations Platform chart. You can then customize your copy of the yaml file based on your specific platform requirements and save it locally. When installing Operations Platform, use your customized values.yaml file in the Helm install command. After you install Operations Platform, you have two options for installing AI Operations Management and Network Operations Management applications:

  • Using AppHub: you can configure all the application parameters using the UI and deploy the application using AppHub. 
  • Using CLI: if you choose CLI to deploy your applications, you need to create and manage the required YAML configuration files (like aiom-values.yaml) manually.

The Operations Platform on-prem sample values yaml file op-values.yaml, is under the samples directory. Following are the available sample files:

  • AWS - <installer chart unzip location>/samples/aws/aws-values.yaml
  • Azure - <installer chart unzip location>/samples/azure/azure-values.yaml
  • GCP - <installer chart unzip location>/samples/gcp/gcp-values.yaml
  • Generic (other) Kubernetes - <installer chart unzip location>/samples/generic/generic-values.yaml
  • Openshift Kubernetes - <installer chart unzip location>/samples/openshift/openshift-values.yaml
  • Embedded Kubernetes - <installer chart unzip location>/samples/op-values.yaml

Ensure that you create a copy of the appropriate yaml file in a directory where you want to retain it for reference. You can also use the same file name op-values.yaml, ensuring that you copy it out of the samples directory.

For example:

For on-prem (OMT with embedded Kubernetes), copy the op-values.yaml and place it in the current directory:

cp ./op-chart/samples/op-values.yaml ./op-values.yaml 

and, after you have created a copy of the sample file that matches your environment, edit your copy of the yaml file vi ./op-values.yaml following the guidance below.

The YAML file is structured into sections using indentation. For example, to locate the global.database.internal parameter, start at the global: section, look for the database: subsection (indented by two spaces), and then find the internal: entry nested within it. 

Don't change any indentation in the YAML file. Update the required values and keep the YAML syntax. Don't change the parameters with explicit comment [DON'T CHANGE] in your yaml file.

The following tables list the parameters in the sample files, note that there are some differences in the parameters for different platforms, you can ignore the parameters which are not in your platform's sample.
 

End user license agreement (EULA)

Parameter group Values Description
acceptEula
Possible values: true/false
Default value: false
 Set the value to true to accept the OpenText EULA to proceed further.

Kubernetes distribution

This parameter is applicable for cloud deployment.

Parameter group Values Description
global.cluster.k8sProvider
Value:
For AWS - aws
For Azure - azure
For OpenShift - openshift
For GCP - gcp
The Kubernetes distribution for cloud deployment. If you’ve copied the sample configuration for your platform, this parameter will already be set correctly.
global.cluster.k8sDomain Default value: cluster.local Set to the existing cluster's domain name. If a custom domain was used during Kubernetes deployment, use the same custom domain for Operations Platform. To verify if cluster.local is your default, use the following command:
kubectl -n kube-system get configmap coredns -o yaml | grep cluster

Relational database

Parameter group Values Description
global.database.internal Possible values: true/false
Default value: false
Edit this section with information of the relational database that you configured during OMT installation. The default value for global.database.internal is "false". 
If you used embedded PostgreSQL for OMT installation, set global.database.internal to "true". The platform supports embedded PostgreSQL for low-footprint deployments only. For low-footprint, you don't need to change any other parameters in this section.

Set global.database.internal to "false" to use an external PostgreSQL.
global.database.type Default value: postgresql The default is postgresql to use PostgreSQL. You can change to "oracle" to use Oracle.

global.database.host
FQDN of DB Server. Required for PostgreSQL and Oracle. For GCP, enter the DNS name that you created in step 3 at Connect to PostgreSQL for GCP at Enable TLS on PostgreSQL.
This parameter is for external database only and MUST be provided when 'internal' is set to "false". For embedded PostgreSQL, comment this line.

global.database.port
Set port for external PostgreSQL and Oracle.
This parameter is for external database only and MUST be provided when 'internal' is set to "false". For embedded PostgreSQL, comment this line.

global.database.tlsEnabled

Possible values: true/false
Default value: true

When set to "true",  pass the database server certificate while running the install.
global.database.oracleSid oracleSid is used for Oracle database only. When specifying Oracle connection details, do not use oracleConnectionString, instead, you must use oracleSid.

OPTIC Data Lake Message Bus HTTPS and SSL node ports

It is not recommended that you change the default ports, however if the default ports are already in use, you can choose any available port between 30000 to 32767.
Parameter group Values Description
global.di.proxy.nodePorts.https 31001 The port through which the Pulsar proxy is exposed. External applications use it to connect to Pulsar for admin operations. If the default port is already in use by another application, change it to an unused port in the range 30000–32767.
 
global.di.proxy.nodePorts.pulsarssl 31051 The port through which the Pulsar proxy is exposed. External applications use it to connect to Pulsar for client operations. If the default port is already in use by another application, change it to an unused port in the range 30000–32767.

 

Docker

Parameter group Values Description
global.docker.registry
Default value:
For AWS -ECR_URL.amazonaws.com

The Docker registry URL.
For Azure -ACR_URL.azurecr.io
For GCP - gcr.io
For Embedded -  localhost:5000
global.docker.orgName Default value: hpeswitom Docker registry org name.
global.docker.imagePullSecret
Image Pull Secret stores the credentials to pull container images from the Docker registry. For the local OMT registry, you don't need to use a username/password or imagepullsecret. Operations Platform uses registry-admin for modifying images in the local registry.
 
imagePullSecret holds the username/password of a docker registry, internal or external. For the local OMT cluster registry, you can access images without a username/password. Hence you can leave this blank. If you want to use an external registry directly without downloading and uploading images, you can specify the registry and give the username/password in Image Pull Secret.

To create the secret:
kubectl create secret docker-registry docker-registry-secret \
  --docker-username=<myDockerRegistryuser> \
  --docker-password=<myDockerRegistrypassword>
After you create the secret, specify the secret: 
global.docker.imagePullSecret: <docker-registry-secret>

External access host

Parameter group Values Description
global.expose.ingressClassName
The Ingress class name used for annotation and spec within the Ingress objects. When left empty, the Ingress class name is automatically set to <namespace>-nginx.
If you are using a custom Ingress class, provide a custom name. For example, "myCustomIngressClassName".
global.expose.setIngressClassAnnotation
When true, this parameter automatically adds the Ingress class in metadata.annotations of the Ingress objects. When left empty, the default value of this parameter is set to true.
To remove the ingress class annotation line, set this parameter to false.
global.expose.setIngressClassSpec
When true, this parameter adds the spec.ingressClassName line in the Ingress objects. When left empty, the default value of this parameter is set to true.
To remove the spec.ingressClassName line from the Ingress objects, set this parameter to false.
global.externalAccessHost The hostname/FQDN (Load balancer or Control plane node) that you can access externally. 
global.externalAccessPort
Select a port on the external access host that will be used to access IDM, AutoPass, and Reporting 
functionality from the browsers. The external access host can be a Load balancer or Control plane node. 
The selected port must not be in-use, and will be used for example to access the Operations Cloud UI.
The port must be unique and cannot be reused for applications that you will later install on this cluster 
(ex. AIOM containerized obm, or NOM containerized nnm).
For OpenShift, the allowed external access port range is 30000-32767.
global.expose.type
Give the service type used for communication. The service type can be NodePort, ClusterIP, or LoadBalancer.
For OpenShift, NodePort is the default.
This parameter is only for AWS.
global.expose.internalLoadBalancer.annotations
This parameter is only for AWS. 
Annotation specified here are applicable to the Load balancer that is created during Operations Platform Installation. 
It specifies the annotations required for the AWS Kubernetes Provider.
global.expose.internalLoadBalancer.ip Type the Load balancer IP address for communication. To get the IP address of the load balancer:
kubectl get svc portal-ingress-controller-svc -n core -o jsonpath='{.status.loadBalancer.ingress[*].ip}{"\n"}' 

This parameter is applicable only for Azure Kubernetes distribution.
global.expose.externalLoadBalancer.ip Type the Load balancer IP address for communication.
This parameter is applicable only for Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Kubernetes distribution.

global.nginx.httpsPort

For AWS - 30143

For Azure and GCP - same port as External Access Port 

The port number for the Nginx load balancer port.

global.rbac.clusterRoleCreate

Default value: false

For AWS: true

 The default value for the parameter is false for all deployments except AWS. When true, creates the necessary ClusterRole and ClusterRoleBinding resources to manage the resources across the entire Kubernetes cluster.

Persistent volume

Parameter group Values Description

global.persistence.enabled

Possible values: true/false

Default value: true

For Embedded, when true, the PVs are automatically created.
Set this to false if you already have existing PVs.

All PVCs are automatically created. You don't need to fill in or change anything in this section.

global.persistence.storageClasses.default-rwx

Default values: 

For AWS/Azure - "op-default"

For GCP - "standard"

For Embedded - "cdf-nfs"

For Red Hat OpenShift - "ocs-storagecluster-cephfs"

The four PVs are created with this storage class name.

In case of AWS, if you have used OMT's NFSProvisioner to create PVs, you need to change the default values of the storageClass parameters to cdf-nfs.

global.persistence.storageClasses.default-rwo

Default value: 

For AWS/Azure - "op-default", 

For GCP - "standard-rwo"

For Embedded - "cdf-nfs"

For Red Hat OpenShift - "ocs-storagecluster-ceph-rbd"

In case of AWS, if you have used OMT's NFSProvisioner to create PVs, you need to change the default values of the storageClass parameters to cdf-nfs. 

OPTIC Data Lake receiver port 

If the default ports are already in use, you can choose any available port between 30000 to 32767.
Parameter group Values Description
global.receiverNodePort 30001 If this parameter is present in your values file, it is obsolete and will not be used, as the OP receiver service is accessible 
only through the ingress externalAccessPort.

Security

Parameter group Values Description
global.securityContext.user

Default value: 1999

 User ID which has the ownership of persistent storage and runtime deployment.
global.securityContext.fsGroup

Default values: 1999

 Group ID which has the ownership of persistent storage and runtime deployment. 

Services

Configure the following services parameters:
Parameter group Values Description
global.services.autopass.deploy

Possible values: true/false

Default value: "true"

 When true, deploys AutoPass capability.
global.services.stakeholderDashboard.deploy Default values: "true" When true, deploys the Operations Cloud capability. 

global.services.opticDataLake.activateDefaultTenant

Default value: "true"

Leave this setting as true, and do not change the value. This onboards the default tenant also known as Provider to all the capabilities in Operations Platform. For more information, see Operations Platform in the Deployment concepts topic.
global.services.opticDataLake.deploy Default value: "true" When true, deploys the OPTIC Data Lake capability.
global.services.opticDataLake.pulsar.deploy Default value: "true" When true, deploys the OPTIC Data Lake's pulsar.
global.services.opticDataLake.textDataAnalysis.deploy Default value: "true"
This is an optional parameter available for Embedded Kubernetes and AWS, you can set it later if you plan to install Application Observability. Application Observability uses the Text Data Analysis Service (TDAS) and OpenSearch database. 
Uncomment this parameter, if you want Text Data Analysis Service (TDAS) deployed with Operations Platform. After you uncomment the TDAS parameter, configure the OpenSearch parameters.
global.services.operationsPlatform.autopass.oracle.defaultTenantUser
Provide the custom Oracle tenant user for AutoPass. Ensure that this user is created in Oracle database with the required permissions. For more information, see Database infrastructure.

If the user is created with the name "Provider", you can skip providing the tenant user for global.services.operationsPlatform.autopass.oracle.defaultTenantUser parameter. When using custom names of your choice to create the tenant user in Oracle, you must pass that custom tenant user name in the global.services.operationsPlatform.autopass.oracle.defaultTenantUser parameter.
global.services.operationsPlatform.autopass.oracle.defaultTenantPassword Set the password for AUTOPASS_ORACLE_DEFAULT_TENANT_DB_USER_PASSWORD_KEY while updating passwords for secrets. For more information, see Secrets on this page.

OpenSearch

If you plan to deploy Text Data Analysis Service (TDAS) with Operations Platform, you must configure the OpenSearch parameters. The following OpenSearch parameters are available only for embedded Kubernetes, AWS, and OpenShift.
Parameter group Values Description

global.openSearch.dbauser

Possible value: admin

Connects to OpenSearch as this DBA user using the password defined in ITOMDI_OPENSEARCH_DBA_PASSWORD.
global.openSearch.embedded

Default value: false

When true, deploys OpenSearch with Operations Platform. Set this parameter to false if you plan to use an external OpenSearch server.
global.openSearch.host

FQDN of external OpenSearch server.

For embedded OpenSearch set it to itom-opensearch.
global.openSearch.port Default value: 9200
Port of external OpenSearch server.
For embedded OpenSearch set it to 9200.
global.openSearch.roUser Default value: "opensearch_rouser" DB User with READ ONLY permission. If you plan to deploy Application Observability with opticDataLake.activateDefaultTenant set to true, you need to set the password for ITOMDI_OPENSEARCH_ROUSER_PASSWORD while updating passwords for secrets. For more information, see Secrets on this page.
global.openSearch.rwUser Default value: "opensearch_rwuser" DB User with READ and WRITE permission. If you plan to deploy Application Observability with opticDataLake.activateDefaultTenant set to true, you need to set the password for ITOMDI_OPENSEARCH_RWUSER_PASSWORD while updating passwords for secrets. For more information, see Secrets on this page.

Vertica

Parameter group Values Description
global.vertica.db Default value: itomdb Vertica database name.
global.vertica.embedded

Possible values: true/false
Default value: false

When false, deploys external Vertica.

Set embedded Vertica to true, to deploy as a containerized service.

Embedded Vertica is not supported for application deployments with Operations Platform.

global.vertica.host

The FQDN of the Vertica server. If using a Vertica cluster with 3 nodes, enter a comma separated list of FQDN of all the 3 nodes.
There shouldn't be any space between a comma separated list of FQDN of the Vertica cluster nodes.

Comment this parameter for embedded Vertica.
global.vertica.port Default value: 5433

External Vertica port for both TLS enabled and non-TLS.

For embedded Vertica, set the port value to 5444.
global.vertica.resourcepoolname Vertica resource pools are a pre allocated subset of system resources for running a queue of queries. 

global.vertica.rwuser

 Default value: vertica_rwuser 
DB User with READ and WRITE permission. 

global.vertica.rouser

 Default value: vertica_rouser 

DB User with READ ONLY permission. 

global.vertica.tlsEnabled

Possible values: true/false
Default value: true

 If you enable TLS, you must give the Vertica Server Certificate while installing Operations Platform.

OpenTelemetry 

Setting OpenTelemetry parameters is optional, you can set the parameters later if you plan to export the metrics to an OTEL collector. For more information, see What is OpenTelemetry? and OTEL collector. 

If you want to export the logs, traces, or metrics to an OpenTelemetry (OTEL) collector, configure the following parameters in the values.yaml file.

Currently, these parameters are available for Embedded Kubernetes and AWS.

Parameter Value Description
global.otel.exporter.enable Default value: false When true, exports the log traces or metrics to an OpenTelemetry (OTEL) collector.  
global.otel.otlp.endpoint Accepted format: https://<host>:<port>/ Endpoint where the telemetry data is sent.
global.otel.otlp.protocol Default value:  Protocol for sending signals to OTLP receiver. Valid values: grpc, http/protobuf, and http/json.
global.otel.otlp.client
global.otel.traces.sampler Default value:  Defines how the traces are sampled. The ParentBased (root=AlwaysOn), samples all child traces if the parent is sampled, which helps in tracing the entire user sessions. Valid values: AlwaysOn, AlwaysOff, TraceIdRatioBasedSampler, ParentBased ( root=<>).

Ingress Config

The global.ingressConfig.appNamespaces parameter is used for backward compatibility during upgrades and is not intended for fresh installations. You can leave this parameter blank or comment it out, both options are valid. For fresh installs, use op-tms-cli tool to register the namespace after installing Operations Platform. For more information, see Register application namespace in Operations Platform.

Tenant management 

Parameter group Values Description

itomditenantmgmt.ditenantmgmt.db.dbauser

Default value: dbadmin

 The DBA Admin user who has permission to create users, resource pools, grant permissions, delete users, and delete resource pools.
itomdimonitoring.monitoringDBUser Default value: vertica_monuser
The vertica user used for monitoring dashboards. The user should match the monitoring user created by dbinit.sh script while configuring the Vertica database.
For embedded Vertica, you must set this parameter to dbadmin.

 Secrets

A secret is an object that has sensitive data such as a password, a token, or a key. You must give all the required secret passwords in Base64 encoded format.

Update all the passwords in secrets to Base64 format, as shown in the example below:

Example:     

If the password for idm_op_admin_password is Testing@123, update the password to Base64 format:          

echo -n 'Testing@123'|base64

Copy the output value and update idm_op_admin_password in the op-values.yaml:

idm_op_admin_password: VGVzdGluZ0AxMjM=

Following are the secrets which require passwords: 
Password 
Description
idm_op_admin_password

Admin Password for Operations Platform admin user, set this password and deploy Operations Platform. This is the password used to connect to Operations Platform. 
The password must meet the following requirements:

  • Length must be at least 8 characters
  • Length can't exceed 32 characters
  • Must contain 1 or more upper case characters
  • Must contain 1 or more lower case characters
  • Must contain 1 or more digit (0-9) characters
  • Must contain 1 or more special characters in: -+"?/.,<>:;[]{}`~!@#%^&*()_=|$
ITOMDI_TENANTMANAGEMENT_DBAUSER_PASSWORD_KEY Tenant management DB Admin user password. For external Vertica, provide the Base64-encoded password of the existing Vertica DB Admin user.
ITOMDI_DBA_PASSWORD_KEY
When opticDataLake.activateDefaultTenant is true, provide the existing Vertica RW user password which you created while configuring the Vertica database.
This password is required only when you're using the provider tenant.
ITOMDI_RO_USER_PASSWORD_KEY
When opticDataLake.activateDefaultTenant is true, provide the existing Vertica RO user password which you created while configuring the Vertica database.
This password is required only when you're using the provider tenant.
ITOMDI_DBMONITORINGUSER_PASSWORD_KEY The vault secret key that contains the password for Vertica monitoring user specified in the itomdimonitoring.monitoringDBUser helm parameter. The password should match the monitoring user password which you created while configuring the Vertica database. 
AUTOPASS_DB_USER_PASSWORD_KEY
Password for AUTOPASS database (PostgreSQL) user. The application will give the username in Helm values.yaml under deployment.database.user of AUTOPASS.
BVD_DB_USER_PASSWORD_KEY
Password for BVD database (PostgreSQL) user. The application will give the username in Helm values.yaml under deployment.database.user of BVD.
IDM_DB_USER_PASSWORD_KEY
Password for IdM database (PostgreSQL) user. The application will give the username in Helm values.yaml under deployment.database.user of IdM.
AUTOPASS_ORACLE_DEFAULT_TENANT_DB_USER_PASSWORD_KEY Password for AutoPass Oracle database tenant user.
ITOMDI_OPENSEARCH_DBA_PASSWORD
If you want to deploy Text Data Analysis Service (TDAS) with Operations Platform, you must provide the ITOMDI_OPENSEARCH_DBA_PASSWORD password. 

The password must meet the following requirements:

  • Length must be at least 8 characters
  • Must contain 1 or more upper case characters
  • Must contain 1 or more lower case characters
  • Must contain 1 or more digit (0-9) characters
  • Must contain 1 or more special characters: -+"?/.,<>:;[]{}`~!@#%^&*()_=|$
  • The password criteria must satisfy the OpenSearch recommended "good password strength". OpenSearch recommends to verify the password strength against a script mentioned on this page, Getting started with OpenSearch security.
For embedded OpenSearch, set a Base64-encoded password.
For external OpenSearch, provide the Base64-encoded password of existing OpenSearch DB Admin user.
ITOMDI_OPENSEARCH_ROUSER_PASSWORD Set the OpenSearch RO user password, only if you're using the provider tenant and  opticDataLake.activateDefaultTenant is set to true. 

The password must meet the following requirements:

  • Length must be at least 8 characters
  • Must contain 1 or more upper case characters
  • Must contain 1 or more lower case characters
  • Must contain 1 or more digit (0-9) characters
  • Must contain 1 or more special characters: -+"?/.,<>:;[]{}`~!@#%^&*()_=|$
  • The password criteria must satisfy the OpenSearch recommended "good password strength". OpenSearch recommends to verify the password strength against a script mentioned on this page, Getting started with OpenSearch security.
ITOMDI_OPENSEARCH_RWUSER_PASSWORD Set the OpenSearch RW user password, only if you're using the provider tenant and  opticDataLake.activateDefaultTenant is set to true.

The password must meet the following requirements:

  • Length must be at least 8 characters
  • Must contain 1 or more upper case characters
  • Must contain 1 or more lower case characters
  • Must contain 1 or more digit (0-9) characters
  • Must contain 1 or more special characters: -+"?/.,<>:;[]{}`~!@#%^&*()_=|$
  • The password criteria must satisfy the OpenSearch recommended "good password strength". OpenSearch recommends to verify the password strength against a script mentioned on this page, Getting started with OpenSearch security.
schedule_mail_password_key Password for scheduling the reports to an email for BVD.
fluentbit_receiver_password_key Password for fluentbit receiver, for example, Elasticsearch.

Ingress controller

Parameter group Values Description

itom-ingress-controller.nginx.service.external.enable

Default value: false

 When false, the NGINX Ingress Controller service is only accessible within the cluster. Set this parameter to true if you want your ingress controller to be accessible from outside the Kubernetes cluster. 
itom-ingress-controller.nginx.service.internal.enable Default value: true When true, deploys an internal-facing service for the NGINX Ingress Controller which is accessible within your internal network.
 

OpenTelemetry 

Currently, these parameters are available for Embedded Kubernetes and AWS.

Parameter Value Description
otel.otlp.client.cert Cert for the client certificate.
otel.otlp.client.key Key for the client certificate.

IdM settings

You must have created the idm database and user names based on the deployment scenario. Ensure that you enter the correct user and database names in this section. 
Parameter group Values Description
idm.deployment.database.dbName
Default value: idmdb
Give database name for idm.
idm.deployment.database.user
Default value: idmuser
Give the user name for idm database.
idm.deployment.database.userPasswordKey
Default value: IDM_DB_USER_PASSWORD_KEY
This refers to the password for idm database (PostgreSQL/Oracle) user. Oracle uses the password as idm schema password. Don't change the userPasswordKey. 

Autopass settings

You must have created the autopass database and user names based on the deployment scenario. Ensure that you enter the correct user and database names in this section. 
Parameter group Values Description
autopass.deployment.database.dbName
Default value: autopassdb
Give database name for autopass.
autopass.deployment.database.user
Default value: autopassuser
Give the user name for autopass database.
autopass.deployment.database.userPasswordKey
Default value: AUTOPASS_DB_USER_PASSWORD_KEY
This refers to the password for autopass database (PostgreSQL/Oracle) user. Oracle uses this as autopass schema password. Don't change the userPasswordKey. 

BVD settings

You must have created the bvd database and user names based on the deployment scenario. Ensure that you enter the correct user and database names in this section. 
If you are planning to Configure Email for Dashboard and Report Schedules using SMTP, bvd.smtpServer.* parameters mentioned in the below table are mandatory.
Parameter group Values Description
bvd.deployment.database.dbName
Default value: bvddb
Give bvd database name.
bvd.deployment.database.user
Default value: bvduser
Give the user name for bvd database.
bvd.params.prometheusHost Default value: itom-prometheus-prometheus.core Give the FQDN of the Prometheus service. Give the namespace where Prometheus is deployed, if Prometheus used any other namespace other than the core namespace.
bvd.params.prometheusPort Default value: 9090 Give the port of the Prometheus service used other than core namespace.
bvd.deployment.database.userPasswordKey
Default value: BVD_DB_USER_PASSWORD_KEY
While running gen_secrets.sh script this key gets created and refers to the password for bvd database (PostgreSQL/Oracle) user. Oracle uses this as bvd schema password. Don't change the userPasswordKey. 
bvd.smtpServer.host
You must give these parameters to schedule the reports to a specified email ID. Give the smtpServer host name.
bvd.smtpServer.port
Give the smtpServer port.
bvd.smtpServer.security
Give the value as TLS or STARTTLS.
bvd.smtpServer.user
Give the user ID for the smtpServer.
bvd.smtpServer.from Give the email ID for the smtpServe used to send the emails

Depending upon the SMTP server 'from' and 'user' fields can be the same or different. 
bvd.smtpServer.passwordKey
Default value: schedule_mail_password_key
This refers to the password for smtpServer (PostgreSQL/Oracle) user. Don't change passwordKey. This is the password key for the mail Proxy user
oracleWallet Pass the Oracle wallet zip's base64 file.

OPTIC Data Lake Message Bus

Parameter group Values Description
itomdipulsar.bookkeeper.volumes.ledgers.name
Default value:
For embedded: "ledgers"
For AWS - "gp3"
For Azure - "managed-premium"
For GCP - "premium-rwo"
 Local volume storage class name
itomdipulsar.bookkeeper.volumes.ledgers.size Default value:

For embedded: 20 Gi

For AWS, Azure, GCP: 20 Gi

 Local volume size
itomdipulsar.bookkeeper.volumes.journal.name
Default value:
For embedded: "journal"
For AWS - "io2"
For Azure - "managed-premium"
For GCP: "premium-rwo"
itomdipulsar.bookkeeper.volumes.journal.size
Default value:
For embedded: 4 Gi

For AWS, Azure, GCP: 4 Gi
itomdipulsar.zookeeper.volumes.data.name
Default value:
For embedded: "zookeeper-data"
For AWS - "gp3"
For Azure - "managed-premium"
For GCP: "premium-rwo"
itomdipulsar.zookeeper.volumes.data.size
Default value:
For embedded: 4 Gi

For AWS, Azure, GCP: 4 Gi
itomdipulsar.zookeeper.volumes.datalog.size
Default value:
For embedded: 4 Gi

For AWS, Azure, GCP: 10 Gi
itomdipulsar.zookeeper.volumes.datalog.storageClassName
Default value:
For embedded: "zookeeper-data"
For AWS - "gp3"
For Azure - "managed-premium"
For GCP: "premium-rwo"

External DNS

You must enter the required values for the parameters mentioned in this table when you have enabled services that include OPTIC Data Lake: 

If you are configuring an application, ensure that the hostnames for OPTIC Data Lake services mentioned in this section are the same as those mentioned in Operations Platform.
Parameter group Values Description
global.di.externalDNS.enabled
 
Possible values: 
true/false
Default value: false
You must set this parameter to "true" if you want to enable access to services outside the Kubernetes cluster.
global.di.externalAccessHost.pulsar
String value for Optic Data Lake Message Bus proxy DNS name. For optimized streaming, Vertica needs to connect to Optic Data Lake message bus. The hostname is the hostname under which Vertica DB can reach OPTIC Data Lake's pulsar proxy.
